docs.lead_paragraph: DURING THE LAST TWO DEC-ades, the job of major league sports commissioner has grown from a comfortable figurehead post to one of the nation's most visible and demanding executive positions. It involves not only the scheduling of hundreds of professional games each season, but also dealing with complex governmental regulation and the negotiation of television and other revenues that amount to hundreds of millions of dollars a year for football and baseball alone. Pete Rozelle, 59, has held the position of National Football League Commissioner for 25 years, presiding over the game's emergence as America's most profitable professional sport. Major League Baseball Commissioner Peter Ueberroth, 48, has held his job slightly more than one year, having come to the post straight from his position as president of the Los Angeles Olympic Organizing Committee for the 1984 Games.

docs.lead_paragraph: The probability that researchers will be able to develop successful measures to control tropical diseases ''has never been greater than it is today,'' according to a report issued by the Congressional Office of Technology Assessment. But the Federal Government is spending less than $100 million a year on tropical disease research, a tiny fraction of its total annual biomedical research budget of well over $4 billion, the Congressional agency estimates.
